message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.NE 

The paper discusses information theoretic approaches to quantifying causal influences, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions the use of these approaches in neuroscience and climate science, which are both areas that often employ machine learning techniques (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed measures also involve identifying direct and indirect causal effects, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of causal inference (cs.SI). Finally, the paper applies the proposed measures to estimate the causal effect of the El Nino-Southern Oscillation on temperature anomalies, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of neural networks and deep learning (cs.NE).
